docs.passage:
[EMAIL 1 START]
Date: Fri, 23 Feb 2001 08:24:00 -0800 (PST)
From: Phillip K Allen (phillip.allen@enron.com)
To: cbpres@austin.rr.com
Cc: 
Bcc: 
Subject: Re: Genesis Plant Tour
Type: replied to EMAIL 0

George,

I can take a day off the week I get back from vacation.  Any day between 
March 5th-9th would work but Friday or Thursday would be my preference.

Regarding the differences in the two estimates, I don't want to waste your 
time explaining the differences if the 1st forecast was very rough.  The 
items I listed moved dramatically.  Also, some of the questions were just 
clarification of what was in a number.  

Let's try and reach an agreement on the construction manager issue tomorrow 
morning.  

Phillip
[EMAIL 1 END]
extracted_triples: a day off the week he gets back from vacation
just clarification of what was in a number
an agreement on the construction manager issue

docs.passage:
[EMAIL 1 START]
Date: Mon, 10 Jul 2000 06:54:00 -0700 (PDT)
From: Phillip K Allen (phillip.allen@enron.com)
To: Al Pollard (al.pollard@enron.com)
Cc: 
Bcc: 
Subject: Re: Katy flatlands
Type: replied to EMAIL 0

Al,

I am not in good enough shape to ride a century right now.  Plus I'm nursing 
some injuries.  I can do lunch this week or next, let's pick a day.

Phillip
[EMAIL 1 END]
extracted_triples: is not in good enough shape to ride
to pick a day for lunch

docs.passage:
[EMAIL 1 START]
Date: 02/15/2000 10:48 AM
From: 
To: Phillip K Allen/HOU/ECT@ECT
Cc: Amelia Alder/OTS/Enron
Bcc: 
Subject: Storage of Cycles at the Body Shop
Type: original

Phillip -
I applaud you for using your cycle as daily transportation.  Saves on gas, 
pollution and helps keep you strong and healthy.  Enron provides bike racks 
in the front of the building for requests such as this.  Phillip, I wish we 
could accommodate this request; however, The Body Shop does not have the 
capacity nor can assume the responsibility for storing cycles on a daily 
basis.  If you bring a very good lock you should be able to secure the bike 
at the designated outside racks.  

Keep Pedalling - Lee
[EMAIL 1 END]

[EMAIL 2 START]
Date: Tue, 15 Feb 2000 04:53:00 -0800 (PST)
From: Phillip K Allen (phillip.allen@enron.com)
To: Hunter S Shively (hunter.shively@enron.com)
Cc: 
Bcc: 
Subject: Storage of Cycles at the Body Shop
Type: forwarded EMAIL 1

Should I appeal to Skilling.
[EMAIL 2 END]
extracted_triples: Phillip K Allen strong and healthy
bike racks in front of the building
storage for cycles at The Body Shop
responsibility for storing cycles on a daily basis
secure the bike at designated outside racks
Phillip K Allen to keep pedaling
